verses.niv: 24 A man of many companions may come to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
verses.kjv: 24 A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
verses.esv:
24   A man of many companions may come to ruin,
    but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

verses.niv: 13 Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.
verses.kjv: 13 Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
verses.esv: 13 Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.

verses.niv: 17 A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
verses.kjv: 17 A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
verses.esv:
17   A friend loves at all times,
    and a brother is born for adversity.

verses.niv: 17 As iron sharpens iron, so one man sharpens another.
verses.kjv: 17 Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
verses.esv:
17   Iron sharpens iron,
    and one man sharpens another.

verses.niv: 9 Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their work: 10 If one falls down, his friend can help him up. But pity the man who falls and has no one to help him up! 11 Also, if two lie down together, they will keep warm. But how can one keep warm alone? 12 Though one may be overpowered, two can defend themselves. A cord of three strands is not quickly broken.
verses.kjv: 9 Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour. 10 For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up. 11 Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm alone? 12 And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
verses.esv: 9 Two are better than one, because they have a good reward for their toil. 10 For if they fall, one will lift up his fellow. But woe to him who is alone when he falls and has not another to lift him up! 11 Again, if two lie together, they keep warm, but how can one keep warm alone? 12 And though a man might prevail against one who is alone, two will withstand him—a threefold cord is not quickly broken.

verses.niv: 33 Do not be misled: "Bad company corrupts good character."
verses.kjv: 33 Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
verses.esv: 33 Do not be deceived: “Bad company ruins good morals.”

verses.niv: 11 Therefore encourage one another and build each other up, just as in fact you are doing.
verses.kjv: 11 Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.
verses.esv: 11 Therefore encourage one another and build one another up, just as you are doing.

verses.niv: 9 Perfume and incense bring joy to the heart, and the pleasantness of one's friend springs from his earnest counsel.
verses.kjv: 9 Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel.
verses.esv:
9   Oil and perfume make the heart glad,
    and the sweetness of a friend comes from his earnest counsel.

verses.niv: 6 Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy multiplies kisses.
verses.kjv: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.esv:
6   Faithful are the wounds of a friend;
    profuse are the kisses of an enemy.

verses.niv: 14 "A despairing man should have the devotion of his friends, even though he forsakes the fear of the Almighty.
verses.kjv: 14 To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.
verses.esv:
14   “He who withholds kindness from a friend
    forsakes the fear of the Almighty.

verses.niv: 28 A perverse man stirs up dissension, and a gossip separates close friends.
verses.kjv: 28 A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
verses.esv:
28   A dishonest man spreads strife,
    and a whisperer separates close friends.

verses.niv: 20 He who walks with the wise grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.
verses.kjv: 20 He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
verses.esv:
20   Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise,
    but the companion of fools will suffer harm.

verses.niv: 24 And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward love and good deeds. 25 Let us not give up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but let us encourage one another--and all the more as you see the Day approaching.
verses.kjv: 24 And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works: 25 Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.
verses.esv: 24 And let us consider how to stir up one another to love and good works, 25 not neglecting to meet together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging one another, and all the more as you see the Day drawing near.

verses.niv: 8 Above all, love each other deeply, because love covers over a multitude of sins. 9 Offer hospitality to one another without grumbling. 10 Each one should use whatever gift he has received to serve others, faithfully administering God's grace in its various forms.
verses.kjv: 8 And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins. 9 Use hospitality one to another without grudging. 10 As every man hath received the gift, even so minister the same one to another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.
verses.esv: 8 Above all, keep loving one another earnestly, since love covers a multitude of sins. 9 Show hospitality to one another without grumbling. 10 As each has received a gift, use it to serve one another, as good stewards of God’s varied grace:

verses.niv: 9 Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their work: 10 If one falls down, his friend can help him up. But pity the man who falls and has no one to help him up!
verses.kjv: 9 Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour. 10 For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up.
verses.esv: 9 Two are better than one, because they have a good reward for their toil. 10 For if they fall, one will lift up his fellow. But woe to him who is alone when he falls and has not another to lift him up!

verses.niv: 24 Do not make friends with a hot-tempered man, do not associate with one easily angered, 25 or you may learn his ways and get yourself ensnared.
verses.kjv: 24 Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go: 25 Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
verses.esv:
24   Make no friendship with a man given to anger,
    nor go with a wrathful man,
25   lest you learn his ways
    and entangle yourself in a snare.

verses.niv: 9 He who covers over an offense promotes love, but whoever repeats the matter separates close friends.
verses.kjv: 9 He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.
verses.esv:
9   Whoever covers an offense seeks love,
    but he who repeats a matter separates close friends.

verses.niv: 26 A righteous man is cautious in friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
verses.kjv: 26 The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
verses.esv:
26   One who is righteous is a guide to his neighbor,
    but the way of the wicked leads them astray.

verses.niv: 4 You adulterous people, don't you know that friendship with the world is hatred toward God? Anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.
verses.kjv: 4 Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.
verses.esv: 4 You adulterous people! Do you not know that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Therefore whoever wishes to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.

verses.niv: 31 Do to others as you would have them do to you.
verses.kjv: 31 And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
verses.esv: 31 And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.

verses.niv: 12 that is, that you and I may be mutually encouraged by each other's faith.
verses.kjv: 12 That is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.
verses.esv: 12 that is, that we may be mutually encouraged by each other’s faith, both yours and mine.

verses.niv: 5 Better is open rebuke than hidden love. 6 Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy multiplies kisses.
verses.kjv: 5 Open rebuke is better than secret love. 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.esv:
5   Better is open rebuke
    than hidden love.
6   Faithful are the wounds of a friend;
    profuse are the kisses of an enemy.

verses.niv: 12 My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you. 13 Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends. 14 You are my friends if you do what I command.
verses.kjv: 12 This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you. 13 Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends. 14 Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.
verses.esv: 12 “This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you. 13 Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends. 14 You are my friends if you do what I command you.

verses.niv: 24 Do not make friends with a hot-tempered man, do not associate with one easily angered, 25 or you may learn his ways and get yourself ensnared. 26 Do not be a man who strikes hands in pledge or puts up security for debts; 27 if you lack the means to pay, your very bed will be snatched from under you.
verses.kjv: 24 Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go: 25 Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul. 26 Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts. 27 If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
verses.esv:
24   Make no friendship with a man given to anger,
    nor go with a wrathful man,
25   lest you learn his ways
    and entangle yourself in a snare.
26   Be not one of those who give pledges,
    who put up security for debts.
27   If you have nothing with which to pay,
    why should your bed be taken from under you?

verses.niv: 7 Dear friends, let us love one another, for love comes from God. Everyone who loves has been born of God and knows God.
verses.kjv: 7 Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.
verses.esv: 7 Beloved, let us love one another, for love is from God, and whoever loves has been born of God and knows God.
